trans-unit.source: Returns a collection of objects involved in concurrency conflicts.
Removes all conflicts from the collection.
Specifies whether a given conflict is a member of the collection.
The specified conflict.
Returns true if the specified conflict is a member of the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
Copies the elements of the collection to an array.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The array to copy to.
The array index where the copy is to start.
Returns the number of conflicts in the collection
integer
Returns the enumerator for the collection.
An enumerator for the collection.
Returns an item in conflict.
Index in the collection of the item in conflict.
An <xref href="System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict"></xref> representing the item in conflict.
Specifies whether the specified conflict is removed from the collection.
The conflict to remove.
Returns true if the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict"></xref> is removed from the collection.
Resolves all conflicts in the collection by using the specified strategy.
One of the options available in <xref href="System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode"></xref>.
Resolves all conflicts in the collection by using the specified strategy.
The strategy to use to resolve the conflict.
If true, automatically resolves conflicts that result from a modified object that is no longer in the database.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1.Add(`0)"></xref>.
Adds an item to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> interface.
The item to add.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> interface.
Returns `true` if the collection is read-only.
Copies the collection to an array.
Name of the array.
Index of the array.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Returns `true` if access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An enumerator that iterates through a collection.
